CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant started enforcement proceedings against a company before the court of GPE ( domestic proceedings no . ORG ) in order to obtain the payment of CARDINAL MONEY ( ORG ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the debtor ( executada ) opposed the proceedings through the introduction of a motion on that regard ( dedução de embargos ) . The motion was granted and remained valid until DATE . In the course of the proceedings , procedural steps were taken in the context of the opposition , which had to be suspended twice while waiting for a final decision in other CARDINAL different proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered the seizure ( penhora ) of the debtor ’s assets , which took place on DATE . The applicant opposed it on DATE . The court ordered the lift of the seizure ( levantamento da penhora ) on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered the suspension of proceedings because of the inactivity of the parties . The proceedings were suspended until DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE several procedural steps took place , mostly notifications , provision of information from the parties and court orders ( despachos ) . On DATE the court ordered the sale of the business establishment that had previously been seized . Several attempts to sell it were made until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE due to the inactivity of the parties the court ordered the proceedings to be suspended once again .
CARDINAL . According to the last information received by ORG on DATE , the proceedings are still pending .
